description: The FHS segment is used to head a file (group of batches) as defined in Section 2.9.3.

1.name: File Field Separator
1.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

10.name: File Header Comment
10.description: free text field, the use of which is not further specified

11.name: File Control Id
11.description: used to identify a particular file uniquely. It can be echoed back in FHS-12-reference file control ID

12.name: Reference File Control Id
12.description: value of FHS-11-file control ID when this file was originally transmitted. Not present if this file is being transmitted for the first time

2.name: File Encoding Characters
2.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

3.name: File Sending Application
3.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

4.name: File Sending Facility
4.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

5.name: File Receiving Application
5.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

6.name: File Receiving Facility
6.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

7.name: File Creation Date / Time
7.description: field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

8.name: File Security
8.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

9.name: File Name / Id
9.description: can be used by the application processing file. Its use is not further specified
